name: Double JPEG Detection
description: Detects periodic DCT artifacts indicating double JPEG compression, which suggests the image may have been edited or AI-generated.
mechanism: Analyzes the periodicity of DCT coefficient histograms across 8×8 blocks. Double compression creates characteristic periodic artifacts in the coefficient distributions.
parameters: Block: 8×8, Coefficients: AC terms, Test: periodicity detection in histograms
source: Lin, Z. et al. (2009) — Fast, Automatic and Fine-Grained Tampered JPEG Image Detection, Pattern Recognition
useCase: Detecting double-compressed images indicating manipulation or AI generation

references.title: Lin, Z. et al. (2009). Fast, Automatic and Fine-Grained Tampered JPEG Image Detection via DCT Coefficient Analysis. Pattern Recognition.

strengths:
• Detects compression history
• Well-established JPEG forensics
• Fast DCT analysis
• High confidence when detected
limitations:
• Only works on JPEG images
• Single-compressed images produce no signal
• Quality factor affects sensitivity
• Some AI outputs avoid JPEG compression
